meanings.definition: To write or draw hastily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: She was scrawbing a quick note before rushing out the door.
meanings.sent2: The students were scrawbing their names on the whiteboard at the end of the class.
meanings.sent3: In her scrawbing haste, she accidentally misspelled her own name.
meanings.sent4: His scrawbing on the paper resembled a chaotic dance of words and doodles.
meanings.sent5: The child's scrawbing on the wall with crayons left a colorful mess behind.

meanings.definition: The act of writing or drawing hastily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: The scrawbing on the desk looked messy and rushed.
meanings.sent2: I could barely read the scrawbing on the torn piece of paper.
meanings.sent3: The scrawbing on the bathroom wall made everyone giggle at its randomness.
meanings.sent4: The scrawbing on the old parchment seemed to tell a story of forgotten words.
meanings.sent5: The scrawbing on the sidewalk was quickly washed away by the rain.
